> Paul Hodgetts wrote:
[snip]
> The main reason we would have the developers write these tests
> is because QA does not yet have the capabilities to write and
> perform these tests, which we can solve by increasing their
> capabilities.  For now we have to cover this somehow.
[snip]

This quote makes me wonder what on earth the QA team is doing?  What do they
do with their time?  And why can't they use one of the GUI Web test tools
from Mercury or Empirix to automate this?  Is it a matter of budget for the
QA team?  Sounds a little fishy -- like "We have a QA team but they don't do
anything with free tools, and they can't afford the COTS tools to do
anything either."

Sorry if I'm jumping to conclusions, but your statements about the QA team
caught my attention.

Scott Stirling
JRun QA
Macromedia
subject: RE: [junit] Need Advice on Unit Testing Pain
